Question: Many, though not all, in the South considered this person as a man of outstanding ability.
Hints: This person became increasingly distant from his father, in part because of his father's lack of education.
With almost no support in the South, this person swept the North and was elected president in 1860.
This person received 1,866,452 votes, Douglas 1,376,957 votes, Breckinridge 849,781 votes, and Bell 588,789 votes.
